text: Leave this to me. Twilight, what have you been up to?

speaker: Sci-Twi
text: Me? Oh, I was just, uh—

speaker: Indigo Zap
text: Who wants to know?!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Um, we do.

speaker: Applejack
text: All right, everyone. Let's not get too competitive before the games even start.

speaker: Sugarcoat
text: The games aren't really competitive since *we've* never lost.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: That's not a very nice thing to say.

speaker: Sunny Flare
text: Sorry, dearie, but these games aren't about being nice.

speaker: Rarity
text: Well, you might use a *little* tact.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Hi, I'm Pinkie Pie!

speaker: Sci-Twi
text: Oh, hi. I'm Twilight.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I know. You look just like my friend. Her name is Twilight too.

speaker: Sci-Twi
text: That's... heh, weird.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: What's that?

speaker: Sci-Twi
text: It's sort of a spectrometer. I built it to track EM frequencies, but it can also contain anomalies. [beat] It measures things.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Like the party?

speaker: Sci-Twi
text: Yeah, though it doesn't look like much of a party to me.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I know. Something is definitely missing. Come on!

speaker: Sci-Twi
text: Aah!

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: Hello, everyone! I'd like to take this opportunity to greet all of our visitors from Crystal Prep Academy and welcome them to CHS.

speaker: Sci-Twi
text: [grunts] What in the world is in these?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Party cannons, of course!

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: And lastly, I would like to recognize the twelve students that CHS has elected to compete. I don't think we could have chosen a better group to represent the excellence, sportsmanship, and friendship the games stand for.

speaker: Sci-Twi
text: Um, are you sure this is a good idea?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Absolutely!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Ooh, floaty!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Aw! Oh. I am party pooped.

speaker: Principal Cinch
text: I'd like to thank Principal Celestia for her unconventional welcome. It's been four years since the last Friendship Games, but it feels as though nothing has changed. Canterlot High continues to pick its competitors in a popularity contest and Crystal Prep continues to field its top twelve students. It is a comfort to know that even after so many years of *losses*, your school remains committed to its ideals, however *misguided* they may be. I wish you all the best of luck, regardless of the inevitable outcome.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh.

speaker: Applejack
text: I'm sorry, Pinkie. I thought your party additions were really swell.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: They definitely broke the ice.

speaker: Rarity
text: Yes. If only that Principal Cinch hadn't frozen it again.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Yeah, she's awful.

speaker: Sunset Shimmer
text: Wow, Pinkie, what happened to you?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I don't know. Everyone started having fun after Twilight and I fired the party cannons and I ponied up.

speaker: Sunset Shimmer
text: Of course you did.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: But then the magic just drained right out of me.

speaker: Sunset Shimmer
text: Wait, what do you mean "drained out of you"?

speaker: Applejack
text: Hey. Where *is* that other Twilight?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh. She's right... Uh, well, she *was* right here.

speaker: Princess Luna
text: [over P.A. system] Good morning, students. I'm sure you're all thrilled to start the first day of the Friendship Games. Our competitors will face off in every aspect of the CHS curriculum, culminating in the elimination equation finale.

speaker: Dean Cadance
text: Welcome to the first event, the Academic Decathlon! You'll be scored on chemistry, home-ec and everything in between. But remember, only the six students from each team with the most points will move on to event number 2. Good luck!

text: Welcome, everyone to the Friendship Games Tricross Relay!

text: In this event, our qualifying competitors will face off in archery, speed skating, and finally, motocross.

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: Well, I know these Friendship Games haven't been what any of us expected, but given what we've all just been through, I think it's fair to declare us all winners.

speaker: Dean Cadance
text: I guess that was *one* way to finish up your time at Crystal Prep. Pretty sure Cinch will be fast-tracking your application after all of that.
